description._content: "The church was erected in the year 1824, and like nearly all the other 'Macquarie Churches' is after the style of an old English village church. It is square built, with a tower, containing a clock at one end, chancel and side entrance porch." - Frank Walker St Peters Church of England is one of the earliest surviving buildings within the town limits of Campbelltown and also one of the oldest Anglican churches found outside of Sydney. In 2013, St Peters Church of England celebrated its 190th birthday, since its establishment in 1823. This image is part of a collection entitled ‘Early Australian Architecture', which is available to view on the Royal Australian Historical Society's Historypin Channel. Access the collection at the following link: www.historypin.com/channels/view/id/48441/#|collections/v... Please feel free to comment on this or any of the other images in the collection. If you have more accurate information regarding the location and/or date of the image, we would love to hear from you!
